30 Things To Do In Chennai To Explore The Southern Pearl Of India In 2025

..
SHARES
Updated Date: 20 January 2025

What comes to mind when you hear the word Chennai? Pristine beaches, beautiful temples and fun activities, right? Well, Chennai is all about it and with so many great things to do in Chennai, you can have a marvellous experience. Chennai, formerly known as Madras is the capital city of Tamil Nadu. Quite famous for its religious sites, beaches, and being an IT hub, Chennai is welcoming and a destination that you must visit at least once in your life. It does not matter if you are here for a weekend or a week, just dont forget to check out some of the amazing things to do in Chennai city and try them out. Chennai is a very developed city and being a coastal city, you will have a lot of fun while you are here.


Table Of Content

23 Best Things To Do In Chennai In 2025

If you were wondering about what are the fun things to do in Chennai then you we will tell you all about it. From shopping to lazing around on the beaches, there is no dearth of things to do in Chennai. So, check them out and see what all activities will you be indulging in on your vacation.

  • Elliots Beach: Witness A Beautiful Sunrise
  • Mahabalipuram: Marvel At The Sculptures
  • Mylapore Musings Kapaleeshwar Temple: Take A Look
  • Muttukadu: Try Water Activities
  • Trekking: Hike Around Chennai For Adventure
  • Queens Land: For The Fun Rides
  • IIT-Madras: Take A Nature Walk
  • Pondy Bazaar: Go On A Shopping Spree
  • Birla Planetarium: Visit The Modern Planetarium Of India
  • National Art Gallery: Be Awestruck By The Art
  • Ubbalamadugu Falls: For Some Nature Photography
  • Pulicat Lake: Admire The View Of Birds Flying In Sync
  • Barracuda Bay: Opt For Fishing With Friends
  • Chennai Cuisine: Treat Your Taste Buds
  • Scuba Diving: Gear Up For Some Thrilling Adventure
  • Lion Safari: Head To Arignar Anna Zoological Park
  • Cultural Tour: Explore The Dakshinachitra Museum
  • Parasailing: Get The Panoramic View Of Chennai
  • Fun Day: Go To MGM Dizzee World
  • Beach Hopping: For All Beach Bums
  • Camping: Get Down To Earth
  • Rock Climbing: Try Out This Activity
  • Paintball: Have Fun With Your Gang

1. Elliots Beach: Witness A Beautiful Sunrise

Experience a bliss while catching the sunrise at Elliots Beach, one of the best things to do in Chennai with friends, family, or solo. Having a stroll in the morning over here is the best way to pass time. It is located in one of the most famous places to visit in Chennai, Beasant Nagar. This beach has a great walking path with a lot of local food joints and it is also close to the shores. There are temples, churches, and monuments in this beach road which makes it the best place for any kind of person to hangout. There is one certain Karl Schmidt memorial that you have to visit.

This has also seen in a lot of movies and it is situated on Elliots Beach. Let your thrill seeker soul indulge in a mesmerising experience of laid-beach vibes and water sports at Elliot Beach. So, if you are wondering what to do in Chennai?, just escape to this haven.

Highlight: Early sunrise stroll. You can come along with your family or friends or just alone to enjoy the tranquility.
Activity cost/Ticket fee: free
Timings: open all-day
Location: Beasant Nagar, Chennai

Also Read: Adventure Sports In Chennai

2. Mahabalipuram: Marvel At The Sculptures

One of the best things to do in Chennai for youngsters, you can rent two-wheelers and start early morning to Mahabalipuram. You have to drive on the East Coast Road and the experience of the drive itself makes it so thrilling that you will have the best time in the day. You can get crazy with your group of friends and you will still love it! You can explore the architectural wonders of the Shore Temple, Arjunas Penance, Pancha Rathas, or Krishna’s Butterball. You will enjoy the whole town because of its built. This place is a declared UNESCO site for the stone-carved wonders.

All the sculptures at Mahabalipuram are amusing and attracts visitors from all over the world. These are packed with the mysteries of the region’s past and are such a retreat for your eyes and senses. You can enjoy the amazing Seashell Museum too!

Highlight: Friends who like to seek outdoor activities as fun. You can visit with your family too.
Activity cost/Ticket fee: free
Entry timing and closing timings: 6 AM- 6 PM
Location: Mahabalipuram

3. Mylapore Musings Kapaleeshwar Temple: Take A Look

Visiting Kapaleeshwar temple is one of the top things to do in Chennai. The Kapaleeshwar Temple was built way back in the 7th century and if you are a history buff, then you have to visit this temple. This famous temple in Chennai depicts the proper Dravidian architecture and it boasts of the different gopurams and the series. The whole temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva, who is represented by a peacock or Mayil. Thus, the town got its name from this temple- Mayilapura or the Town of Peacocks.

You will find maamis in the temple who are dressed in their bright sarees, maamas chanting shlokas. If you are seeking a blissful place in the heart of Chennai then it is one of the best places to visit in Chennai and seek blessings. The atmosphere is vibrant, and you will fall in love with it. This town, Mylapore, is considered equal to Kailasa.

Highlight: Historic sites.
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Free unless you want a special darshan
Timings:5 AM- 12:30 PM & 4 PM-8PM
Location: Kapaleesvarar, Kesava Perumal Sannathi St, Vinayaka Nagar Colony, Mylapore, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600004

Related Post: Tourist Places Near Chennai

4. Muttukadu: Try Water Activities

Muttukadu Boat House is a water sports facility on the East Coast Road. Enjoy an adrenaline-filled experience as there are plenty of thrilling activities to do in Chennai. This is the backwater area of the mighty Bay of Bengal and is around 35 km away from the city center. There are around 15 row boats, 27-speed boats and pedal boats too. The place offers serene surroundings to spend time and witness the most scenic views of nature. Also, visitors are welcome to enjoy various water sports and create countless memories in Chennai.

This boating spot is quite famous; more than 4000 people visit every weekend. So, if looking for top things to do in Chennai with friends, come and visit Muttukadu Boat House. This experience will surely add an extra dose of charm in your trip.

Highlights: Friends and family relatives. You will love it here if you plan a Saturday or Sunday with your cousins.
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Varies, you can find the information online. But, they take INR 130 for 30 minutes of row boating.
Timings: 9 AM-6 PM
Location: East Coast Road, Muttukadu, Tamil Nadu 603103

5. Trekking: Hike Around Chennai For Adventure

Looking for some adventurous things to do in Chennai with friends ? Try out the treks in Chennai! Chennai is a coastal city that has a lot to offer like scenic drives, sightseeing, adventure sports, etc. It also has quite a few trekking options too. There are different grades of treks that you can do in and around Chennai. The complete trek is based on the length of the trip and the place of choice.

Famous among trekking enthusiasts, there are many places in Chennai where you can have a thrilling and quite challenging trekking experience. It doesn’t only allow visitors to add some extra excitement to their trip but also has a unique experience to add to your travelling diaries. No mountain is not conquerable, so get your boots on and go for that expedition of trekking near Chennai.

Highlights: Adventure seekers
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Variable
Timings: It usually begins early in the morning around 6 AM.
Location: East Coast Road, Chennai.
Stay options: Camping at the site of trek

Related Post: Most Haunted Places In Chennai

6. Queensland: For The Fun Rides

If you are fond of amusement parks and want to enjoy amusement park vibrant vibe in Chennai then head to Queensland to take some fun rides. It is one of the best things to do in Chennai for all ages. Spread over 70 acres, this theme park is huge. It offers a total of 51 rides, including both water and land rides. You can do some crazy and thrilling stuff here and enjoy all the rides you can get. Freefall down a height of 150 feet, crash into cars and splash through water on twisters and slides are some of the major attractions. Its a splendid place for group outings.

Loaded with tropical and subtropical rainforests, Queensland is among the most vibrant places of Chennai where you can witness the colorful coral, fish, and turtles. So, if you are looking for exciting, fun weekend activities in Chennai, visit Queensland.

Highlight: Fun, you can plan a day with families or friends, etc
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 550 for adults, INR 450 for kids and no charge for children below 2 ft.
Timings: 9:30 AM 6 PM. It is closed on Mondays
Location: Chennai-Bengaluru Highway, Palanjur, Sembarambakkam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600123

7. IIT-Madras: Take A Nature Walk

Do you like to take nature walks back to your place? Do you find it relaxing when you hear the birds chirping early in the morning? Its therapeutic, right? One of the best things to do in Chennai city is to take the early morning nature walk at IIT Madras. The campus is actually a part of the Guindy National Park, and the vegetation here is tropical, dry, and evergreen. There is a special deer park, too, where several spotted deer have been introduced into the campus in the park.

There are more than hundreds of varieties of birds and other aerial insects. Also, you can have delicious snacks in the cafes on campus, which are available at very affordable prices. A perfect place to hangout with your friends. If you are a bird watcher, then this place is heaven for you.

Highlights: Calm activity or a hangout date.
Activity cost/Ticket fee: free
Timings: Open 24/7
Location: IIT Madras, Chennai

Related Post: Picnic Spots In And Around Chennai

8. Pondy Bazaar: Go On A Shopping Spree

If you want exciting things to do in Chennai, go on a shopping spree in Pondy Bazaar. You can purchase anything from here, be it jimikki, kammal or comfortable slippers. Pondy Bazaar, a tourist shopping spot for all ages, offers a wholesome Chennai shopping experience. Here, dont forget to taste that strongly brewed cup of coffee at Geetha Caf. It is an absolute delight to be there! You can also shop at night and it is often viewed as one of the fun things to do in Chennai at night.

Holding the dignity of being one of the biggest shopping markets in Chennai, Pondy Bazaar has a wide variety of traditional and Western wear, home decor, shoes and many more. You can also explore many multi-brand retail shops there. So, if you cannot decide what things to do around Chennai, this is your ideal place.

Highlights: A fun day out.
Activity cost/Ticket fee: No activity cost.
Timings: 10 AM- 8 PM (though the market starts at 8 AM, things dont really start to kick off until 10 AM)
Location: Parthasarathi Puram, T. Nagar, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600017

9. Birla Planetarium: Visit The Modern Planetarium Of India

Visiting and exploring the different aspects of Birla Planetarium is among one of the best things for youngsters to do in Chennai. It is one of the most modern planetarium in India. The planetarium is home to a fully computerized projector that portrays astronomical objects on a hemispherical dome. The Planetarium presents audiovisual programs on various themes in astronomy. Adjoining the planetarium is the Periyar Science and Technology Museum, which interests students and other science enthusiasts. Here, visitors can also enjoy its educational shows and innovative approach to spreading knowledge.

Amusing visitors with sky shows and different themes of astronomical facts, events and achievements, Birla Planetarium is such an amazing place to add to your itinerary and get lost in the visual world of astronomy. A perfect place to plan a unique date with your loved ones under the visual night sky.

Highlight: A place to go with friends and family
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 45 for adults and INR 25 for children. You can view the Science Center, Planetarium, 3D Science Movie and Science Park.
Timings: 10 AM- 5:45 PM
Location: Gandhi Mandapam Road, Duraisamy Nagar, Kotturpuram, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600025

Related Post: Beach Resorts In Chennai

10. National Art Gallery: Be Awestruck By The Art

The National Art Gallery was built of sandstone in 1907 by T. Namberumal Chetty. Earlier, it was called Victoria Memorial Hall, as it was built during Queen Victorias Golden Jubilee in a particular Indo-Saracenic style. Portraits of many British officers, like Lord William Bentinck, are also in the Gallery, and visiting the place is often regarded as one of the best things to do in Chennai.

The gallery features an amazing collection of over 15,000 paintings, prints, sculpture, and decorative arts that capture the attention of history buffs and people with curious minds from all over the world. If you are fond of ancient and modern art artefacts, then it is one of the best places to visit in Chennai and adds an amazing experience to your travelling diaries. This place is such a retreat for your eyes and senses where you can observe vast range of arts.

Highlights: People who love art. Visit with friends or family.
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 15 for adults and INR 10 for children.
Timings: 9 AM- 5 PM , Closed on national holidays and Fridays only
Location: Inside Government Museum Complex

11. Ubbalamadugu Falls: For Some Nature Photography

One of the offbeat things to do in Chennai is opting for nature photography at the famous Ubbalamadugu Falls. If you are a water baby then this the best place to let the inner kid out. The water from the falls channelizes its path through huge canyons which is a sight to see. If you are traveling with your kids then you must head to this place to admire the natural beauty as it is one of the best things to do in Chennai with kids. It is also known as the name of Tada Falls and attracts nature lovers from all over the world. Flaunting its crystal clear water and picturesque vistas, Ubbalamadugu Falls is encircled by an evergreen forest that adds up the extra charm to the glory of the falls.

Along with admiring natural charm, you can also visit this place for a great trekking and hiking experience. Also, don’t forget to take countless insta-worthy pictures amidst the wonderful beauty of the fall and explore luxurious resorts near Tada Falls.

Highlight: Family, friends, kids, nature lovers
Activity cost/Ticket fee: NA
Timings: 8 AM- 4 PM
Location: Andhra Pradesh 517541

Related Post: Wildlife Sanctuaries Near Chennai

12. Pulicat Lake: Admire The View Of Birds Flying In Sync

Listed among the top things to do in Chennai is bird watching at the Pulicat Lake . The place is mostly crammed with birds, especially during the migratory season. Also known as Pazhaverkadu, this lake holds the dignity of being the second-largest brackish water lake in India. Tourists are fond of this place as they can enjoy flamingo-watching. Pulicat Lake is also famous among thrill seekers as here you can experience numerous water activities. One of the most interesting facts about the lake is that it houses India’s satellite launching facility, Satish Dhawan Space Centre.

If you are a nature lover, then there is no better place to witness some of the most beautiful natural vistas in Chennai than Pulicat Lake. You will also find several photographers strolling around here early in the morning or in the evening to get that perfect shot and capture the natural beauty.

Highlights: Nature lovers, animal lovers
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Free
Timings: Anytime
Location: Coromandel Coast, Andhra Pradesh

13. Barracuda Bay: Opt For Fishing With Friends

Now if you are travelling with your friends and want to indulge in one of the cool things to do in Chennai then you must head to the popular Barracuda Bay which gives a chance to interact with nature again. This place is also famous among adventure seekers as they can enjoy variety of activities here, like fishing. Apart from a thrilling experience, you can also explore the Barracuda Bay Sport Fishing Club, where you can learn three types of fishing, including popping, jigging, and trolling. Also, the scenery of the place is amusing and delights the eyes and senses of nature lovers.

If you are looking for a day escape away from the noisy city life, it is one of the best places to head and spend quality time with your loved ones. So, for a day hangout, you can add this place to your itinerary.

Highlights: Adventure enthusiasts
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Free
Timings: Anytime
Location: Chennai, India

Related Post: Romantic Places In Chennai

14. Chennai Cuisine: Treat Your Taste Buds

A trip to any place remains incomplete without trying its local dishes. So, if you are planning for a Chennai tour any time soon then make sure that you try out the main dishes from their cuisine. Some of the not-to-be-missed dishes are Dosa, Idli Sambhar, Vada, Chili Parotha, Paniyaram, Uttapam, Idiyappam, Biryani, and many more. There are myriad of options available in restaurants where you can have delightful cuisine of the region at affordable prices. It is the right way to treat your taste buds and add an amazing food experience to your travelling diaries.

If you are looking for some sweet options then head out to taste different types of kulfi. They are available in different flavors like saffron, pista, rose, cardamom, mango, and more. Enjoying the street foods in Chennai for an amazing experience.

Highlight: Foodies Paradise
Activity cost/Ticket fee: NA
Timings: Anytime
Location: Anywhere in Chennai

15. Scuba Diving: Gear Up For Some Thrilling Adventure

Rising temperatures definitely call for a dip into the cold waters of Chennai.If you are looking for some thrilling water activities, then head to Covelong Beach, which is an ideal location forscuba diving in Chennai. With shipwrecks to explore underwater and beautiful sceneries, it is the best place for this activity. The Scuba diving experience will surely charm your trip and allow you to create countless everlasting memories. After that, you can rest on the beach and admire the clear waters against a beautiful sunset to end your day on a good note.

It is listed among one of the most amazing things to do in Chennai for couples. Rameshwaram is one of the best places to enjoy scuba diving, where many beaches offer water sports activities for adventurous souls. So, add some extra thrill in your trip and enjoy scuba diving with your loved ones in Chennai.

Highlight: Perfect treat for Adventure souls
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 6,000 per person (approx.)
Timings: NA
Location: Covelong Beach, Chennai

Related Post: Road Trips From Chennai

16. Lion Safari: Head To Arignar Anna Zoological Park

If your heart lies in the wilderness and if you love to explore the flora and fauna of a place then the perfect place for you is the Arignar Anna Zoological Park. It is one of the most famous picnic spots in Vandalur and is perfect for families with children. Covering an area of 1,260 acres, this is a one-of-its-kind zoo which houses 138 species of exotic and endemic animals. A safari in this zoo will let you glimpse lions, elephants, Indian civet cats, and tigers. Apart from safari, you can also enjoy elephant rides and let your kids explore the childrens park. If you are fond of wildlife, then this place is no less than a paradise for you.

You can capture countless pictures and enjoy wildlife photography as well. Observing wild animals to this close is among the adventurous things to do in Chennai and enjoy your trip like never before.

Highlight: Friends, family, nature lovers
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 50 (Adults), INR 20 (Children below 12 years)
Timings: 9 am – 5 pm (Closed on Tuesdays)
Location: Grand Southern Trunk Rd, Vandalur, Tamil Nadu 600048

17. Cultural Tour: Explore The Dakshinachitra Museum

Taking a delightful tour of Dakshinachitra Museum is among the best things to do in Chennai , which lets you take a dive into its history and culture. It displays a great deal of works that represent the lifestyle of South India. It houses more than 4,000 artefacts and 10,00,000 pictures depicting local culture. The museum is developed as a village with 18 authentic houses that exhibit how people used to live. So, if you are a culture vulture, you must head to Dakshinachitra Museum.

The place will give you an entire vibe like a heritage village and showcase a vast range of displays and relocated originals that enchant the tales of life patterns of southern India’s residents. Visitors can also enjoy witnessing crafts, folk-performing-arts and architectural art, which will surely be a retreat for their eyes and senses.

Highlight: Perfect place for History Buffs
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 110 (Adults), INR 50 (Students from 13-18 hours)
Timings: 10 am – 6 pm (Mon-Fri), 10 am – 7 pm (Sat-Sun), Closed on Tuesday
Location: SH 49, Muthukadu, Tamil Nadu 603118

Related Post: Wildlife Sanctuaries Near Chennai

18. Parasailing: Get The Panoramic View Of Chennai

Chennai is not just a place of temples and beaches. If you dig deeper then you can find some amazing activities to indulge in like parasailing. During this activity, you are tied with a parachute which is connected with a motor speed boat. As the boat moves forward with speed, the parachute blows into the sky, taking you with it. You soar high in the sky and get to witness the turquoise-blue ocean. Parasailing allows you to add some extra thrill to your trip, as well as enjoy the panoramic views of the beach and the Bay of Bengal. It is a perfect activity to do in Chennai with your friends.

Some of the best beaches near Chennai to enjoy safe parasailing are Marina Beach and Covelong Beach. It can be enjoyed with two or three people and counted among the best things to do in Chennai with your loved ones.

Highlight: Adventure souls
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 2,000 per person (approx.)
Timings: NA
Location: Covelong Beach, Chennai

19. Fun Day: Go To MGM Dizzee World

Looking for a place where you can have fun with your gang or family? Well, Chennai has got just the right place for you and it is none other than MGM Dizzee World. The park was opened in 1993 and has captured the attention of thrill-seekers, as well as joy seekers, since its inauguration. It is one of the oldest and the largest amusement parks in India which is why it is teeming with people all the time. Several thrill rides cater to the adventurous souls of people. Earlier, it also had a hot air balloon ride which was the major attraction in the early days.

With several thrill rides to explore, this is one of the best places to explore in Chennai with kids. Not only this, water junkies are welcome to enjoy various water sports and enjoy the splashing. Packed with lots of surprises for people of all ages, MGM Dizzee World is such an amazing place to explore.

Highlight: Friends, Family, Couples
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 549 (Children), INR 699 (Adults)
Timings: 10:30 am – 6:30 pm (Mon-Fri), 10:30 am – 7:30 (Sat-Sun)
Location: 1/74, SH 49, Muthukadu, Tamil Nadu 600112

Related Post: Water Parks In Chennai

20. Beach Hopping: For All Beach Bums

Chennai is dotted with several beaches that is why beach hopping is one of the top things to do in Chennai for couples. One can opt for water activities on Covelong Beach, then head to Eliots Beach and Marina Beach for a beautiful view. Those looking for less-crowded beaches are welcome to explore Pebble Beach, Kasimedu Beach, Neelankarai Beach, and Santhome Beach for a quaint escape. Apart from this, there are some vibrant beaches that you can also explore in Chennai, such as Breezy Beach, Akkarai Beach, Nettukuppam Beach, VGP Golden Beach, and Thiruvanmiyur Beach.

All these beaches are packed with amazing vibes and activities that will surely make your day memorable and allow you to indulge in laid-back, beachy vibes like never before. One can relax, explore, indulge in activities, laze around, and enjoy sunsets at these beaches.

Ideal for: Beach bums, couples, family, friends
Activity cost/Ticket fee: NA
Timings: NA
Location: All over Chennai

21. Camping: Get Down To Earth

There are several spots in and around Chennai that are best suited for camping and exploring the nature places. So, if you are in search of places where you, along with your gang, can pitch a tent amidst natural surroundings then you will not be disappointed with these places. There are places like Tada Falls, Pulicat Lake, Chembarambakkam Lake, Mamandur, Nagalapuram, Peermade Waterfalls, and more. With foliage and waterfalls nearby, these places are best for pitching your tent. It is one of the fun activities in Chennai to do with your friends and family.

Highlight: Friends, nature lovers
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 2,000 per person (approx.)
Timings: Anytime
Location: Several places in and around Chennai

Suggested Read: Chennai In December

22. Rock Climbing: Try Out This Activity

One of the most adventurous things to do in Chennai in one day is rock climbing. Climbing is said to be an ideal alternative for regular gyms as it tests your strength and perfects the core. The best part about this activity is that you dont have to do it under the scorching sun. Instead, you can do it at Fit Rock Arena where you will be provided with the same facilities but indoors. If you like to feel a rush of adrenaline, this is one of the best things to do in Chennai, adding an extraordinary experience to your travelling diaries.

So, if you are looking for some strength-related activities then the best option is to opt for indoor rock climbing. The ideal time for rock climbing in Chennai is between December and February.

Highlight: Adventurous people
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 700 for 2-hour session (approx.)
Timings: NA
Location: 73, Venkatakrishna Rd, Perumal Koil Thottam, Ramakrishna Nagar, Raja Annamalai Puram, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600028

23. Paintball: Have Fun With Your Gang

One of the coolest things to do in Chennai is to opt for a paintball session with your friends. If you and your gang love to play combat games in reality then this is the best option. Get ready with your combat suit and your weapon to paint the opposite gang. By exercising your entire body and increasing your heart rate, you are strengthening your endurance. Your confidence rises as you go on the field. So, if you are planning to explore Chennai with your friends then you can include this activity in your itinerary.

The excitement of battle and the sheer quantity of fun make paintball extremely popular in Chennai. Paintball is a great way for business team building groups to practice decision-making under a crisis.

Highlight: Perfect place to hangout with friends
Activity cost/Ticket fee: INR 400 per person (approx.)
Timings: 10 am – 8:30 pm (Mon-Thurs), 10 am – 9 pm (Fri), 9 am – 9 pm (Sat-Sun)
Location: 168/3D, Pattipulam, East Coast Road, 2kms from Dolphin city, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 603104

Related Post: Hotels In Chennai

24. Visiting Iskcon Temple: To Experience Divinity

Visiting Iskcon Temple and seeking blessings are among the blissful things to do in Chennai. Lies on the East Coast Road of South Chennai, this place is packed with divinity and spreads a spiritual aura. The temple was constructed in 2012 and houses the glorious idol of Lord Krishna with Radharani. Apart from this, you can also pay homage to gorgeous deities of Subhadra, Baladev, Lord Jagannath, Chaitanya and Lalita. One of the most interesting things about ISKCON temple is that it is adorned with the Kalinga and Pallava kingdom’s architecture and its floor is covered with crystal clear marble. The temple combines cutting-edge scientific technologies with a variety of cultural influences.

In an effort to draw in more and more followers of the ISKCON movement, the temple administrations host talks and video programs centered around Hindu philosophy. This spritual gem is a wonderful place to add in your itinerary and have a blissful experience.

Highlight: Seek solace and indulge in divinity
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Free
Timings: 7.30 AM – 1 PM, 4 PM- 9.15 PM
Location: ISKON TEMPLE, Bhakti Vedanta Swami Rd, Akkarai, Sholinganallur, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600119

25. Guindy National Park Tour: For Spotting Wildlife

Counted among the eighth smallest national parks of India, Guindy National Park tour is among the top things to do in Chennai for an adventurous experience. The park lies at the centre of the city and draws the attention of wildlife junkies from all around the world. Guindy National Park was constructed in 1978 and amusing visitors since its inauguration. Here, viistors can witness a vast variety of flora and fauna and add a charming experience to their travelling diaries. Housing more than 350 species of vegetation, the part offers an amazing retreat for the eyes and senses of the nature lovers.

Wildlife enthusiasts are welcome to have a close encounter with more than 14 species of wild animals, as well as 150 species of birds. If you want to spend some quality time amidst nature’s lap, as well as spotting wildlife scenes then it is a perfect spot to land on.

Highlight: Spotting Wildlife
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Rs. 20 for adults and Rs. 15 for children
Timings: 10 AM- 5 PM
Location: Rangeguindy, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600025

Related Post: Offbeat Chennai Getaways

26. Outing At Chembarambakkam Lake: Enjoy Serene Surroundings

If you want to enjoy some time away from the husle and bustle of city life then you are welcome for a wonderful outing a Chembarambakkam Lake. Planning a weekend outing here is among the top things to do in Chennai with your loved ones. Its serene and calm surroundings are worth witnessing and capturing countless insta-worthy pictures to add some extra charm in your visit. Visitors can also explore a vast species of vegetation along with enjoying the blissful view of blue freshwater. It is also an ideal spot for family picnic where you can spread a mat and bring some food and enjoy it while admiring the most beautiful scenery of nature.

One of the most interesting things about this place is that you may also have encountered some rare migratory birds. Don’t forget to pay visit to Shiva Temple and Kanni Koil which is situated nearby and worth exploring during your visit here.

Highlight: Explore serene surroundings and water sports
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Free
Timings: 6 AM – 6 PM
Location: Kancheepuram district, Tamil Nadu, South India

27. Exploring Iconic Buildings And Statues At Marina Beach: Another Beach Gem

Holding the dignity of the longest beach in India, Marina Beach is among the must-visit gems in Chennai that are worth exploring. This beach has captured the attention of vacationers since 1881 and amused them with its serene surroundings. Marina Beach spans over an area of 13 kilometres and is usually loaded with many food vests and shopping stalls. Also, there are myriads of monuments and buildings that still enchant the tales of the region’s past. One of the most interesting things about Marina Beach is that it hosted the first aquarium of India in the year 1990, which was a grand event and captured the attention of great crowds from all over the world.

The place also offers a romantic horse riding experience, which will surely be an everlasting experience, and they can also enjoy the panoramic vistas of the city from the Chennai Lighthouse. There are also many places to visit near Marina Beach.

Highlight: Perfect place to hangout with friends
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Free (approx.)
Timings: 12 AM- 11.59 PM
Location: Marina Beach, Tamil Nadu

Related Post: Nightlife In Chennai

28. Visiting Santhome Church: For A Blissful View

Counted among the three wonders of this world, Santhome Church is a blissful place where the tombs of the disciples of Christ reside. This Church holds a great religious significance and attracts not only Christian followers but people from all religions worldwide. Dedicated to the memory of saint Thomas, the church is standing as a symbol of encouraging multi-culture and religous harmony. If you are in search of a worshipping place to seek solace and eternal peace, then this church is a wonderful place to add to your itinerary.

Before, it was constructed as a mausoleum, but later, it was transformed into a basilica. Visiting the Santhome Church and indulging in its divinity are among the best things to do in Chennai.

Highlight: Seek solace and peace with exploring multi-culture and religous harmony
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Free
Timings: 6 AM to 9 PM
Location: 12, Rosary Church Road, Santhome, Mylapore, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600004

29. Stroll Around Thalankuppam Pier: A Fishing Hamlet

Thalankuppan Pier is a tiny fishing hamlet situated in the northern part of Chennai that grabs the attention of fishing hunters. It is known for offering a therapeutic experience to visitors, as well as amusing them with its majestic vibes. The village is well-known for being the ideal getaway for spending some quality time in the middle of nature and is a haven for nature enthusiasts. The peaceful and picturesque Thalankuppam River is a primary draw for visitors to the area. Visit this location in the early morning or evening to take in the breathtaking dawn and sunset views for the greatest experience.

Even though this is one of the most beautiful places, you should still explore its serene surroundings. Taking endless photos while strolling around Thalankuppan Pier is one of the best things to do in Chennai.

Highlight: Perfect place for fishing and enjoying sunset views
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Free
Timings: 6 AM – 6 PM
Location: Beach Rd, Nettukuppam, Ennore, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600057

Related Post: Weekend Getaways From Chennai

30. Water Splashing In Muttukadu: Best Places For Water Sports

Muttukadu is a small town surrounded with lush greenery and scenic vistas. Counted among the must-visit places in Chennai, the place is famous for offering various water sports facilities. Flaunting its serene surroundings and charming black waters, Muttukadu tour is among the amazing things to do in Chennai. The place captures the attention of thrill seekers as they can enjoy various water sports activities such as boating, scuba diving, snorkelling, kayaking, and much more.

Along with adventurous vibes, the place is also adorned with historical charm, where you can indulge in the enchanting tales of the region’s past. For an extraordinary experience in Chennai, must add this place in your itinerary.

Highlight: Water sports activities for adventure seekers
Activity cost/Ticket fee: Depend on the activity you select
Timings: 9 AM7 PM
Location: Muthukadu, Tamil Nadu

How To Reach

By Flight
To reach Chennai, you can take flight from any metropolis city to Chennai International Airport. Airport is just 19 km away from the main city.
By Rail
The Southern Railway’s headquarters are located in Chennai, which also has Chennai Central (MAS) and Chennai Egmore (MS), two significant train stops. These stations are well-connected from the major cities across India.
By Road
Chennai benefits from convenient access to the entire country because to a system of highways and expressways. The National Highways 16, 32, and 48 are a few of the major routes in Chennai that link the city to other regions of India.

Related Post: Parthasarathy Temple Chennai

Best Time To Visit


Visiting Chennai can be an enjoyable experience if you time your trip according to the city’s seasonal patterns.
Winter Season
Winter season is an ideal time to visit Chenai as it is relatively cooler and more comfortable. During this time, the temperature ranging from 20C to 30C.
Summer Season
Chennai experiences moderate to heavy rainfall during the monsoon season. The weather can be humid and unpredictable, but the rain can provide some relief from the heat.
Post-Monsoon
The weather begins to cool down and become more pleasant after the monsoon season. Temperatures are relatively comfortable, and theres less humidity.

Tips For Travellers

Here are some tips for travellers visiting Chennai:

    • The best time to visit Chennai is during the festival of Pongal and musical festival.
    • It is advised to wear breathable clothes to tolerate the warm climate of Chennai.
    • Always stay hydrated and use sunscreen, especially if youre visiting during the hotter months.

You May Also Like To Read: Churches In Chennai

Let your adventurous soul indulge in an amazing experience with these things to do in Chennai. It is always better to learn a little local language but it is manageable as most people do understand and speak English. The food here is awesome and any random tiffin center in the morning should serve you delicious breakfast, so dont forget to try that out as well and plan your trip to Chennai.

Frequently Asked Questions About Things To Do In Chennai

What are the top attractions to visit in Chennai (Madras)?

The top attractions to visit in Chennai are Marina Beach, Government Museum Chennai, San Thome Cathedral Basilica, Fort St. George Museum and Guindy National Park.

Where can I spend a day in Chennai?

There are ten popular places you can explore in a day on your trip to Chennai. These are:
1. Sri Parthasarathi Temple
2. Valluvar Kottam
3. Government Museum
4. San Thome Cathedral Basilica
5. Kapaleeshwarar Temple
6. Semmozhi Poonga
7. Marina Beach
8. T. Nagar
9. Vivekananda House
10. MGR Film City

What are the most popular things to do in Chennai with kids?

The top sights in Chennai that can be enjoyed along with kids include B.M. Birla Planetarium, Arignar Anna Zoological Park, Chennai Snake Park Trust, VGP Universal Kingdom, Dakshina Chitra Museum, Marina Beach etc.

What are the popular things to do in Chennai with family?

You can go around Elliots Beach or take a walk at Marina Beach in the morning. You can even go to Anna Centenary Library or Sabha hopping during the music season.

What is Chennai known for?

Chennai is famous for a lot of things but it is especially famous for its temples including Kapaleeshwarar, Vadapalani Murugan Temple, Parthasarathy Temple, Asthalakshmi Temple, Thiruneermala Vishnu Temple, etc.

How can one spend 2 days in Chennai?

Travellers can visit the Government Museum, Marina Beach, Sri Parthasarathy Temple, Elliot Beach, MGR Memorial, San Thome Basilica, Birla Planetarium to spend 2 days in Chennai.

Which is the richest area in Chennai?

Boat Club, Poes Garden, East- Coast Road, Nungambakkam, Velachery, Adyar, Gopalapuram and OMR are among the posh areas of Chennai.

What is Chennai famous food?

Pongal is the most famous food in Chennai. There are other must-try items, such as Dosa, Chicken 65, Samosas, etc.

Which are the best places for trekking in and around Chennai?

Some of the best places for trekking near Chennai are as follows:
1. Mamallapuram Lighthouse Trek
2. Nagalapuram Trek
3. Tada Falls Trek
4. Trek to Talakona Waterfalls
5. Parvathamalai Mountain Trek
6. Gingee Fort Trek

Which are the best destinations for a wildlife safari in Chennai?

If you want to enjoy wildlife safari then you can visit the following places in Chennai:
1. Arignar Anna Zoological Park
2. Guindy National Park
3. Vedanthangal Bird Sanctuary Chennai
4. turtle walk
5. Mudumalai Wildlife Sanctuary

Which are some of the best beaches for watersports in Chennai?

Water junkies are welcome to explore these beaches for the best watersports experience:
1. Elliot Beach
2. Marina Beach
3. Kovalam Beach Road
4. VGP Golden Beach
5. Covelong Point Kasimedu Beach

Which are the best adventure activities to do in Chennai?

Some of the top things to do in Chennai with friends are as follows: Trekking, Mountain Camping, Cycling, Rock Climbing, ATV Rides, Paramotoring, Canyoning, Scuba Diving, Surfing, Laser Tag, Paintball, Paragliding.
